availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: H. W. Norris (Boyd County, Kentucky, tailor and hotel keeper)

body.p: Boyd County, Kentucky, hotel keeper and justice of the peace. Virginia native. Married to Catharine Moore Norris in Scioto County, Ohio, on June 4, 1846. Father of Arabella Norris, Gary Norris, George W. Norris, Marcellus Norris, William H. Norris, Claude D. Norris, Frank Norris, and Luella Norris. Tailor in Scioto County, Ohio, in 1850. Hotel Keeper in Boyd County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned Miranda [Unknown] and Charlotte [Unknown] in Boyd County in 1860. Appointed a justice of the peace in Boyd County in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Scioto County, Green, p. 150A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyd County, Ashland, p. 817.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Boyd County, p. 146B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyd County, Catlettsburg, p. 103B.
Ohio Marriage Records, 1774-1993, Scioto County Marriages, Film 000292694.
"Judge H. W. Norris (unknown-1886)," Find A Grave, Memorial 82947930, accessed October 19, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/82947930.
